title: Legal expert weighs in on Mayor Mitch Landrieu’s possible house arrest
content:
Please enable Javascript to watch this video 

NEW ORLEANS (WGNO) - On Friday, the New Orleans mayor could be put under house arrest. Civil Court Judge Kern Reese gave Mitch Landrieu one week to come up with a “meaningful resolution” to pay city firefighters $75-million in pensions and back pay dating back decades. 

The fire union says, in total, the city owes them roughly $200-millions. 

With house arrest looming, all eyes are on the mayor. WGNO Anchor Jacki Jing spoke with our legal analyst Craig Mordock to get his input on this decades-long battle. Click the video above to see what Craig had to say.
